column4: QUESTION: If I've already installed ubuntu with gnome, can i change the desktop enviroment to Xfce later on?
yes, there is a kubuntu-desktop package for KDE, and xubuntu-desktop package for XFCE
I can't find it in synaptic!
try at the commandline, apt-cache search xubuntu-desktop.  Does it find it?
Any ideas why i cant find it in synaptic?
I'm not sure; let me see if it's in my Synaptic
do you have the 'universe' repos listed in Synaptic?
hhmm, not sure, i'll have a look
I'm a noob at this, i'm a win geek =)
How do i install it then? =)
we'll Enlighten you yet :)  If you wish to get the package installed from the command-line, use the command:  sudo apt-get install xubuntu-desktop
Hate terminals, thats why i use windows =)
I prefer them, so I generally don't use synaptic :)
But why wouldn't it show up i synaptic?
